abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings convey a satisfactory
            project outcome, likely sustainability, but only modest
            institutional development impacts, supported by satisfactory
            performances by both the Bank and Borrower. Lessons are as
            follows. 1) Lending in the social protection sector - The
            launching of the Unified System of Beneficiary Selection was
            a significant achievement for the Government. However, for
            it to reach its full potential, and ensure objective
            targeting of social safety net programs, the system may need
            to be adapted to address specific requirements of particular
            agencies. The census of beneficiaries also needs to be
            carried out with a transparent sampling plan (to avoid any
            appearance of favoritism of urban/less poor areas over poor
            rural areas). Also of importance are the local technical
            expertise, technical capability, and, the complexity of the
            issue of undocumented families and individuals. 2) Lending
            in a crisis situation - the experience of this operation
            demonstrates that in a crisis situation, Bank lending can
            effectively achieve short-term crisis alleviation, along
            with modest advances on medium policy actions. Flexibility,
            setting realistic expectations and a frank appraisal of
            risks as input to program design (the establishment of loan
            conditions), and, collaboration across sectors and with
            other major donors are critical to success in Bank lending
            under these conditions, although moral hazard remains a risk.
